Description: CONTRIBUTE TO PEACEFUL CO-EXISTENCE AND ACTIVE CITIZEN PARTICIPATION IN DEMOCRATIC PROCESSES BY MITIGATING FEAR WITHIN COMMUNITIES AND PROMOTING HUMAN RIGHTS AND FUNDAMENTAL FREEDOMS.

TO INCREASE CITIZENS INFLUENCE ON POLICIES AND LEGISLATIVE PROCESSES FOR GREATER ACCOUNTABILITY, TRANSPARENCY, AND INCLUSIVENESS, FOCUSING ON WOMEN, YOUTH, AND PERSONS LIVING WITH DISABILITIES WHILE PROMOTING HUMAN RIGHTS FOR ALL.

THE PROJECT WILL INFLUENCE POLICY MAKERS TO BECOME MORE DEMOCRATIC AND MAKE INFORMED DECISIONS WITH REGARDS TO THE NEEDS OF GIRLS AND YOUNG WOMEN. GIRLS AND YOUNG WOMEN WILL BE EMPOWERED TO HOLD ACCOUNT THE NATIONAL LEADERSHIP AND MAKE DEMANDS.
EFFECTIVE DEMOCRACY REQUIRES THAT CITIZENS UNDERSTAND ELECTIONS AS AN ACCOUNTABILITY EVENT. PROJECT FOCUS IS TO CAPACITATE YOUNG CITIZENS.
ENHANCE CITIZEN CAPACITIES TO ENABLE THEM TO PARTICIPATE IN THE ELECTORAL PROCESSES AT ALL LEVELS.
TO ESTABLISH A SUSTAINABLE NATIONAL ANTI-CORRUPTION NETWORK OPERATING ACROSS CIVIL SOCIETY, PRIVATE SECTOR, THE MEDIA, TRADITIONAL AUTHORITIES, FAITH-BASED ORGANIZATIONS AND OTHER NON-STATE ACTORS
TO INCREASE RURAL CITIZENS' PARTICIPATION IN DEMOCRATIC PROCESSES RELATED TO COMMUNITY CONSERVATION.
TO ESTABLISH A GREATER ACCOUNTABILITY LINK BETWEEN THE GOVERNMENT AND THE PUBLIC ON NAMIBIA'S USE OF STATE RESOURCES.
STRENGTHEN ELECTORAL AND POLITICAL PROCESSES BY ENHANCING MULTIPARTY DIALOGUE AND PARTICIPATION OF  YOUTH IN POLITICAL AND ELECTORAL PROCESSES.
IMPROVE GOVERNANCE AND ELECTORAL REFORMS

TO CARRY OUT A PROGRAM TO PROMOTE HUMAN RIGHTS OF MEMBERS OF MARGINALIZED GROUPS BY SUPPORTING THE FIGHT AGAINST DISCRIMINATION AND HUMAN RIGHTS VIOLATIONS AND ABUSES AGAINST MEMBERS OF TOGO MOST VULNERABLE COMMUNITIES.
TO PROMOTE WOMENS FUNDAMENTAL RIGHTS BY REDUCING GBV, PROMOTING ACCESS TO IDENTIFICATION DOCUMENTS, AND TRAINING GIRLS TO COMBAT ONLINE-HARASSMENT.
TO STRENGTHEN THE CAPACITY OF THE RWANDAN MEDIA TO DELIVER HIGH QUALITY INVESTIGATIVE JOURNALISM
TO STRENGTHEN  THE  CAPACITY  OF  JOURNALISTS  TO  ENGAGE  IN  SAFE  AND SUSTAINABLE  INVESTIGATIVE  JOURNALISM  ON  LOCAL  COMMUNITIES PRIORITIES.
EMPOWER RWANDAN CITIZENS TO ADVOCATE FOR THEIR INDIVIDUAL LAND RIGHTS RELATED TO EXPROPRIATION AND ADVOCATE FOR BROADER POLICY AND PROCEDURAL CHANGES
TO ENHANCE PROTECTIONS FOR LGBTQI+ COMMUNITIES THROUGH SENSITIZING STATE AND LOCAL POLICE FORCES TO VULNERABLE POPULATIONS AND ENSURING THEIR RIGHTS ARE PROTECTED.
THE PROJECT GOAL IS TO STRENGTHEN THE CAPACITY, AND REDUCE BARRIERS FOR THE PARTICIPATION, OF PERSONS WITH DISABILITIES AND THE ELECTORAL ACTORS IN MOZAMBIQUE.
TO INCREASE THE PARTICIPATION, VISIBILITY, AND ACCESS OF PERSONS WITH DISABILITIES IN DEMOCRATIC PROCESSES IN  CABO DELGADO.
THE PROJECT WILL DEVELOP, IMPLEMENT AND FOLLOW UP ON INCLUSIVE INTERVENTIONS THAT SEEK TO INCREASE THE PARTICIPATION OF PWD IN DEMOCRATIC PROCESSES, MAINLY IN MOZAMBIQUE'S ELECTIONS IN 2023.

STRENGTHEN THE DEMOCRATIC PROCESSES AND NORMS IN MOZAMBIQUE BY INCREASING THE CAPACITY OF THE JUDICIARY TO CORRECTLY AND IMPARTIALLY ADJUDICATE ELECTORAL DISPUTES AND BUILD UNDERSTANDING OF THE ELECTORAL FRAMEWORK AMONG CITIZENS AND POLITICAL PARTIES.

TO HELP THE NATIONAL AUTHORITIES TO PUT IN PLACE A TRANSPARENT ET CONFIDENTIAL ELECTORAL SYSTEM AND MEET THE INTERNATIONAL STANDARDS OF DEMOCRACY AND HUMAN RIGHTS. ALSO, SAHEL FOUNDATION WILL INCLUDE EFFORTS TO COMBAT SLAVERY AND GENDER-BASED VIOLENCE.

THE OBJECTIVE OF THIS PROJECT IS TO MOBILIZE THE EFFORTS OF COMMUNITIES TO ERADICATE SLAVERY BY DESCENT AND GENDER BASED VIOLENCE IN THE WILAYAS OF HODH EL CHARGHI ADRAR DAKHLETT NOUADHIBOU AND TIRIS ZEMMOUR. AND TO SUPPORT THE FULL AND EQUAL INCLUSION
IMPROVE THE HUMAN RIGHTS ENVIRONMENT AND INJECT CRITICAL CAPACITY BUILDING EFFORTS TO PROMOTE GOOD GOVERNANCE AND INCLUSIVE POLITICAL PARTICIPATION
TO PROMOTE AND PROTECT HUMAN RIGHTS AND FUNDAMENTAL FREEDOMS IN MAURITANIA THROUGH SECURING THE HUMAN RIGHTS TO LIFE AND EDUCATION

THE PROJECT AIMS TO CONTRIBUTE TO THE PROMOTION OF CHILDREN'S AND WOMEN'S RIGHTS WITH A FOCUS ON VULNERABLE GROUPS SUCH AS MARGINALIZED WOMEN AND TALIBE BY STREGTHENING THE CHILD PROTECTION SYSTEM BASED ON CHILD PROTECTION STRATEGY (SNPE)
THE PROGRAM WILL EMPOWER SURVIVORS OF SLAVERY TO BE ABLE TO FULLY PARTICIPATE IN SOCIETY AND LIVE INDEPENDENT AND FULFILLING LIVES
TO CONDUCT VOTER EDUCATION, SHORT-TERM ELECTION OBSERVER TRAINING, AND TO PROVIDE MATERIAL AND TRANSPORTATION SUPPORT FOR ELECTIONS OBSERVERS
TO CREATE THE BASIS FOR POLITICAL AND LEGISLATIVE CHANGE TO PUT GREATER POWER FOR NATURAL RESOURCE MANAGEMENT IN THE HANDS OF DISADVANTAGED RURAL COMMUNITIES.

RAISE AWARENESS OF CHILD RIGHTS AMONG THE LOCAL POPULATION, IMPROVE THE CAPACITY OF LOCAL HUMAN RIGHTS DEFENDERS AND SERVICE PROVIDERS TO ASSIST CHILD VICTIMS, AND INCREASE ACCOUNTABILITY OF AUTHORITIES IN HAUT KATANGA TO PROTECT CHILDREN.
PROMOTING TRANSPARENT AND INCLUSIVE GOVERNANCE IN THE GAMBIA
TO SUPPORT POLITICAL INCLUSION BY PLACING SOMALIS FROM MARGINALIZED AND MINORITY COMMUNITIES INTO FELLOWSHIPS IN THE FEDERAL PARLIAMENT AND SOUTH WEST STATE.
THE PURPOSE IS TO EMPOWER AND SUPPORT PEOPLE LIVING WITH DISABILITIES IN KISANGANI THROUGH TRAINING FOR ADVOCACY, MEDIA CREATION, AND PROVIDERS.
CONTRIBUTE TO REINFORCING THE IMPLEMENTATION OF OPEN GOVERNMENT PRINCIPLES IN 20 MUNICIPALITIES IN BENIN UNTIL 2022.
PROVIDING PLATFORMS FOR ENGAGING GOVERNMENT ON TRANSPARENT AND ACCOUNTABLE COVID-19 EXPENDITURE.
THIS ARDF WILL PROVIDE CAPACITY BUILDING TO LOCAL NGOS TO ENHANCE NONPROFITS ABILITY TO APPLY AND MANAGE ARDF FUNDS
THIS ARDF WILL HELP TO IMPLEMENT A WATCH DOG ON HUMAN RIGHTS AND GOVERNANCE AND TO MONITOR 2022 PRESIDENTIAL ELECTIONS
THIS ARDF WILL HELP TO CONDUCT A NATIONWIDE AWARENESS-RISING CAMPAIGN ON HUMAN RIGHTS AIMING AT CONTRIBUTING TO THE PUBLIC AWARENESS OF FUNDAMENTAL RIGHTS
THIS ARDF WILL HELP TO PROVIDE COMPREHENSIVE CARE FOR LGBTQ VICTIMS OF TIP IN EQUATORIAL GUINEA
THIS ARDF PROJECT WILL HELP TO PROVIDE COMPREHENSIVE TRAINING COURSE ON SUSTAINABLE FARMING PRACTICES TO LOCAL WOMEN-LED COOPERATIVES FOR SUSTAINABLE LIVELIHOOD AND FINANCIAL INDEPENDENCE
THIS ARDF PROJECT WILL HELP ENFORCING HUMAN RIGHTS TO REMOTE AREAS OF THE COUNTRY AND MONITOR PRESIDENTIAL ELECTIONS

THIS ARDF WILL HELP TO CONDUCT A HUMAN RIGHTS AWARENESS CAMPAIGN DEDICATED TO ENSURING THAT LOCAL PRISONS, JAILS, AND DETENTION CENTERS COMPLY WITH THE CONSTITUTION, DOMESTIC LAW, AND HUMAN RIGHTS PRINCIPLES.

THIS ARDF WILL HELP TO TO EMPOWER WOMEN LIVING IN RURAL AREAS AND WOMEN WITH DISABILITIES IN THE BIOKO ISLAND BY TEACHING THEM TAILORING SKILLS FOR THEM TO START SMALL TAILOR SHOPS FOR A SUSTAINABLE LIVELIHOOD

TO GENERATE SPACES AND STRATEGIES FOR PARTICIPATION OF CIVIL SOCIETY IN EQUATORIAL GUINEA BASED ON PARTICIPATORY DEMOCRACY AND HUMAN RIGHTS AS WELL AS COORDINATE AND PROVIDE A SPACE TO OFFER FOOD AND SUPPLIES FROM MONDAY TO FRIDAY TO ST
GENERATE SPACES, AND PARTICIPATION STRATEGIES FOR CIVIL SOCIETY IN EQUATORIAL GUINEA MARGINALIZED GROUPS.

RESPOND TO KEY BOTTLENECKS TO THE EMPOWERMENT OF WOMEN IN CABO VERDE THROUGH REINFORCING PHYSICAL AUTONOMY AND ECONOMIC AUTONOMY, PROMOTING ELIMINATION OF GENDER INEQUALITIES AND ACCESS TO DECENT WORK AND ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITIES.
STRENGTHEN THE CAPACITY OF THE JUDICIAL SYSTEM AND CAREGIVERS TO SUPPORT CHILD VICTIMS OF SEXUAL VIOLENCE AND IMPROVE PUBLIC AWARENESS.
FACILITATE ISSUANCE OF BIRTH CERTIFICATES FOR 2,000 CHILDREN IN THE COUNCILS OF BANGANGTE, PETE BANDJOUN, BAYANGAM AND DEMDENG IN THE WEST REGION, TO BENEFIT 10,000 PERSONS.

CONTRIBUTE TO REINFORCING WOMEN'S AND GIRLS' RIGHTS IN SECONDARY SCHOOLS IN MAROUA III IN THE FAR-NORTH REGION, THROUGH GENDER EQUALITY EDUCATION, THE FIGHT AGAINST SEXUAL AND GENDER-BASED VIOLENCE AND THE PROMOTION OF PEACE, TO BENEFIT 8,246 PERSONS.
PREVENT AND COMBAT THE SEXUAL AND COMMERCIAL EXPLOITATION OF CHILDREN IN THE TRI-BORDER AREA (CAMEROON-GABON-EQUATORIAL GUINEA) AT AMBAM AND KYE OSSI IN THE SOUTH REGION TO BENEFIT 20,000 PERSONS.
PROMOTE PEACE AND SOCIAL COHESION THROUGH THE ESTABLISHMENT OF A CLIMATE OF INTERGENERATIONAL DIALOGUE IN KOLOFATA, IN THE FAR-NORTH REGION, TO BENEFIT 9,273 PERSONS.
CONTRIBUTE TO THE DEVELOPMENT OF WOMEN'S POTENTIAL TO PREVENT, IDENTIFY, AND ACT AGAINST RADICALIZATION AND VIOLENT EXTREMISM IN MORA SUBDIVISION IN THE FAR-NORTH REGION, TO BENEFIT 2,500 PERSONS.

ACCOMPANY WOMEN IN ORGANIZING THEMSELVES TO PARTICIPATE IN EDUCATION, PROTECTION AND PREVENTION OF RADICALIZATION AND RECRUITMENT OF YOUTH IN NON-STATE ARMED GROUPS IN MAYO BALEO AND MAYO SAVA IN THE FAR-NORTH REGION, TO BENEFIT 8,000 PERSONS.
PROMOTE ACCESS TO JUSTICE AND PEACEFUL CO-EXISTENCE BETWEEN MBORORO CATTLE HERDERS AND THEIR CROPS FARMING NEIGHBORS IN THE WEST, ADAMAWA AND FAR-NORTH REGIONS, TO BENEFIT 1,350 PERSONS.

ENHANCE ACCESS TO JUSTICE AND INCREASE THE RESPECT FOR FUNDAMENTAL RIGHTS AND FREEDOMS BY BUILDING THE SKILLS OF LAWYERS, MAGISTRATES, AND CIVIL SOCIETY LEADERS ON STRATEGIC LITIGATION IN THE NORTHWEST AND SOUTHWEST REGIONS, TO BENEFIT 7,000 PERSONS.

STRENGTHEN SKILLS OF FEMALE HRDS, DEFENDERS OF VULNERABLE HUMAN RIGHTS PLUS LGBTQIA,  COMMUNITY AND OPINION LEADERS ON REGIONAL AND INTERNATIONAL HUMAN RIGHTS PROTECTION MECHANISMS AND INSTRUMENTS IN THE CENTER, ADAMAWA, LITTORAL TO BENEFIT 950 PERSONS.

ENHANCE THE RIGHTS OF INDIGENOUS BAKA PYGMIES THROUGH STRATEGIES TO MITIGATE CONFLICTS BETWEEN THE BAKAS AND OTHER STAKEHOLDERS IN THE GOVERNANCE OF FOREST MANAGEMENT UNITS AND COMMUNITY FORESTS AT LOMIE IN THE EAST REGION, TO BENEFIT 3,000 PERSONS.
ADVOCATE FOR, STRUCTURE AND SUPPORT LOCAL COMMUNITIES FOR THE HUMANIZATION OF WIDOWHOOD RITES IN NDE AND MENOUA DIVISIONS OF THE WEST REGION, TO BENEFIT 51,000 PERSONS.

ENHANCE PEACEFUL COHABITATION BETWEEN INDIGENOUS BAGYELI PYGMIES AND BANTUS AND SECURE TRADITIONAL LIVING SPACE FOR PYGMIES IN TEN COMMUNITIES AROUND BIPINDI IN THE SOUTH REGION, TO BENEFIT 15,600 PERSONS.

PROVIDE PSYCHOSOCIAL AND JUDICIAL ASSISTANCE TO DETAINED CHILDREN IN TARGET LOCALITIES BY ENSURING THEIR ACCESS TO EDUCATION AND THE RIGHT TO IDENTITY IN THE EAST REGION, REACHING OUT TO 4,000 PERSONS.
CONTRIBUTE IN REDUCING THE INCREASE OF VIOLENCE AND VIOLATIONS OF THE RIGHTS OF 249 LGBTQI+ PEOPLE AND THEIR DEFENDERS IN CAMEROON.

PREVENT, REDUCE AND RESPOND TO THE RISK AND CONSEQUENCES OF VIOLENCE COERCION, DEPRIVATION, AND ABUSE OF TEENAGE IDP YOUTHS ATTESTED VICTIMS OF TRAFFICKING IN PERSONS, DOMESTIC VIOLENCE, AND TRAFFICKING IN THE NORTHWEST REGION, REACHING 2,400 PERSONS.
ENSURE PROTECTION OF IDPS OF THE ANGLOPHONE CRISIS BY PROVIDING CIVIL DOCUMENTS TO THOSE IN NEED, TARGETING 600 PERSONS IN THE SOUTHWEST REGION.

RAISE AWARENESS OF 8000 PEOPLE ON TRAFFICKING IN PERSON (TIP), ENHANCE THE CAPACITIES OF CSOS ON TIP AND RESPOND TO THE NEEDS OF TRAFFICKED VICTIMS IN MEZAM AND WOURI DIVISIONS IN THE LITTORAL AND NORTHWEST REGIONS.
FIGHT AND PREVENT VIOLENCE AGAINST WOMEN THROUGH OLD AND NEW FORMS OF COMMUNICATION IN THE CENTER, WEST, LITTORAL AND EAST REGIONS, REACHING OUT TO 23,000 PEOPLE.
CONTRIBUTE TO THE DOCUMENTATION, INFORMATION, DEFENSE AND PROTECTION OF HUMAN RIGHTS IN CONFLICT-AFFECTED REGIONS IN CAMEROON, TO BENEFIT 6,953 PEOPLE.
ENHANCE PEACEFUL COHABITATION BETWEEN INDIGENOUS BAGYELI PYGMIES AND BANTUS AND SECURE TRADITIONAL LIVING SPACE FOR PYGMIES IN THREE COMMUNITIES IN THE SOUTH REGION, TO BENEFIT 4,440 PERSONS.
FACILITATE ISSUANCE OF BIRTH CERTIFICATES FOR 3,000 CHILDREN IN THE COUNCILS OF TONGA AND NDIKINIMEKI IN THE WEST AND CENTER REGIONS.
PROMOTE THE RIGHTS OF WOMEN AND GIRLS TO MITIGATE GENDER-BASED VIOLENCE THROUGH FAITH-BASED INSTITUTIONS IN FAKO, IN THE SOUTHWEST REGION, BENEFITTING 2,500 PERSONS.
ADVOCATE FOR THE FACILITATION OF WIDOWS' RIGHTS TO ACCESS LAND IN THE COUNCIL OF NGANHA IN ADAMAWA REGION, AND THEIR EMPOWERMENT THROUGH INCOME GENERATING ACTIVITIES (IGAS) TO BENEFIT 78,090 PERSONS.
PROMOTE AND POPULARIZE CIVIC EDUCATION IN AN EFFORT TO ERADICATE VIOLENCE IN SCHOOLS IN THE NORTH REGION AND BENEFIT 99,122 PERSONS.

ASSIST ARMED-CONFLICT-PRONE NEIGHBORHOODS IN  BAMENDA III COUNCIL AREA, IN THE NORTHWEST REGION, FOR 5,000 PERSONS TO BOUNCE BACK FROM THE SHOCKS AND STRESSES AND BECOME MORE RESILIENT THROUGH THE RESUMPTION OF NORMAL ACTIVITIES.

RAISE THE AWARENESS OF 5,600 PERSONS IN FIVE SUBDIVISIONS IN THE FAR-NORTH REGION FOR AN EFFECTIVE AND EFFICIENT CONTROL OF PUBLIC INVESTMENT THROUGH THE INVOLVEMENT OF THE COMMUNAL BRANCHES OF THE CNJC (NATIONAL YOUTH COUNCIL OF CAMEROON).

STRENGTHEN INTEGRITY PILLARS (TRANSPARENCY, ACCOUNTABILITY, INCLUSIVENESS AND FREE ACCESS TO INFORMATION) IN LOCAL GOVERNANCE THROUGH CITIZENS PARTICIPATION AND USE OF INNOVATIVE TECHNIQUES FOR 10,000 PERSONS IN THE WEST REGION.
INCREASE 2,000 WOMEN'S LEADERSHIP AND PARTICIPATION IN THE PROCESSES OF PREVENTION AND MANAGEMENT OF CONFLICT AND POST-CONFLICT SITUATIONS, PEACE BUILDING AND SOCIAL COHESION IN ALL CAMEROON.
SUPPORT THE PROMOTION OF INCREASED PARTICIPATION OF 1,500 WOMEN AND YOUTH IN THE MANAGEMENT OF LOCAL PUBLIC AFFAIRS IN MAROUA 1, FAR-NORTH REGION.
STRENGTHEN THE CIVIC AND POLITICAL PARTICIPATION OF 2,060 YOUNG PEOPLE IN THE FORMULATION AND MONITORING OF PUBLIC POLICIES AT LOCAL LEVEL IN THE LITTORAL REGION.

PROVIDE TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE RELATED TO EFFECTIVE VOTER REGISTRATION METHODS, )ESPECIALLY REGARDING REFORMED VOTER REGISTRATION PROCEDURES) WITH AN EYE TOWARD IMPROVING TRANSPARENCY AND INCLUSIVENESS.
DEVELOPING INFORMATION, TRAINING, AND COMMUNICATION TO PREVENT CHILD TRAFFICKING
EMPOWERING CHADIAN WOMEN AND GIRLS
ENDING FGM IN CHAD

CARRY OUT A PROGRAM TO PROMOTE GREATER SOCIAL ACCEPTANCE OF LGBTQI+ PERSONS, INCLUDING ACTIVITIES WORKING WITH GOVERNMENT OFFICIALS, INFLUENTIAL RELIGIOUS AND TRADITIONAL LEADERS; AND TO ADVOCATE FOR PROTECTION AGAINST DISCRIMINATION IN THE WORKPLACE.
THE PROGRAM IS TO RAISE AWARENESS OF CHILD LABOR AND TO EMPOWER CIVIL SOCIETY AND LOCAL LEADERS TO ENSURE GOVERNMENT ENFORCES LAWS TO PROTECT CHILDREN
TO INCREASE THE ROLE AND INFLUENCE OF WOMEN IN BOTSWANA POLITICAL INSTITUTIONS AND DECISION-MAKING.
ENHANCING COMPREHENSIVE GOVERNANCE ACROSS THE GAMBIA
TO ASSIST IN THE DEVELOPMENT OF MATERIALS TO INVESTIGATE AND PROSECUTE HUMAN TRAFFICKERS.
DEVELOP PUBLIC BROADCAST CONTENT TO INCREASE AWARENESS OF HUMAN TRAFFICKING AND HOW TO DETECT AND REPORT SUSPECTED CASES.
